summary: Open data—like the spending data the Treasury Department shares on USAspending.gov —can increase transparency to promote public trust in government. Because the data have broad appeal among users such as grant recipients, Congress, and the public, it's important to make the data as usable as possible. We identified 5 key practices for transparently reporting government data. For example, websites should facilitate data discovery by presenting...
title: Open Data: Treasury Could Better Align USAspending.gov with Key Practices and Search Requirements
